articles.title: The campaign to persuade Trump to investigate the Federal Reserve chief - The Washington Post
articles.description: It’s not clear how the inquiry into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was approved, but housing regulator Bill Pulte met with President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago, and shared a prop resembling a “wanted poster” he had made up featuring Powell.

articles.description: Stock Market Today: The Dow Jones index climbs but the Nasdaq composite outperforms it and the S&P 500. Nvidia tests a key moving average.

articles.title: Abivax CEO Says Big Pharma Can’t Ignore Its Experimental Drug - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Abivax SA’s shares pared gains after France’s finance ministry said it has not been contacted by Eli Lilly & Co. about a possible bid for the French biotech.

articles.description: Dina will be a member of Meta’s management team, helping guide the company’s overall strategy and execution.

articles.title: How US politics is affecting international travel - BBC
articles.description: As tourism to the US plunges because of perceived risks, some travellers are now second-guessing whether it's safe to visit destinations Trump has recently threatened.

articles.title: Ho hum holiday: Retail's early results show modest growth in critical shopping season - CNBC

articles.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

articles.title: Wegmans is scanning your face at some stores. It’s not the only company - CNN
articles.description: Wegmans, the supermarket chain known for its cult-like following, angered some loyalists after revealing it uses facial recognition technology at New York City stores.

articles.title: China and the EU agree on steps to resolve their dispute over EV imports - ABC News
articles.description: China and the European Union say they have agreed on steps toward resolving their dispute over the bloc's imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles

articles.title: Investor behind Moderna says U.S. policy is ‘taking a sledgehammer to our miracle machine’ - statnews.com

articles.title: Gold and silver spike to record highs after Powell says DOJ subpoenas are latest Trump attempt to influence monetary policy - Sherwood News
articles.description: “The threat of criminal charges is a consequence of the Federal Reserve setting interest rates based on our best assessment of what will serve the public, rather than following the preferences of the president,” Powell said.

articles.title: RFK Jr.'s MAHA movement has picked up steam in statehouses. Here's what to expect in 2026. - CBS News
articles.description: "Make America Healthy Again" policies driven by HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. have made major strides in state legislatures, with food additives among the most common targets.

articles.description: Posting on Truth Social, Trump said he would "no longer let the American Public be 'ripped off' by Credit Card Companies."

articles.title: FDA-funded study of pulse oximeter accuracy yields surprising and confusing results - statnews.com
articles.description: A long-awaited study commissioned by the FDA has muddied the path forward on how to reduce racial bias in pulse oximeter readings

articles.description: Lender argues that proposals to significantly increase requirements have already cost investors $40bn
